intro: Sida laxifolia, commonly known as silky sida, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, white or pink flowers. Its leaves are typically ovate or elliptical with a hairy surface, giving it a soft appearance. Sida laxifolia is often found in sandy or disturbed soils and is adapted to coastal environments.
